image.altText: A composite image of Chris Ellison, Kerry Stokes and Gina Rinehart.

props.synopsis: A parliamentary inquiry puts the WA Labor Government at odds with some of the country's wealthiest businesspeople after discounting the idea they should be allowed to export onshore gas.

title.children: WA Government on collision course with billionaires Kerry Stokes, Gina Rinehart, Chris Ellison over gas policy

image.altText: Four people in formal clothes walking on street

props.synopsis: The brother of Senator Linda Reynolds tells a court it was difficult finding his sister very unwell and "rolled up in a ball" on a couch over allegations about how she treated Brittany Higgins.

title.children: Former defence minister found 'rolled up in a ball' on couch over Brittany Higgins allegations, court told

image.altText: A close up of a stone cross on top of a church roof with grey background.

props.synopsis: The identities of child abusers should be listed on the website of the institution they belong to and as part of a centrally accessible register of perpetrators, a parliamentary inquiry finds.

title.children: 'Unholy wall of silence': Inquiry slams Christian Brothers for trying to hide abuse and limit payouts

image.altText: Man in white shirt and sunglasses holding a coffee cup, walking with others around him

props.synopsis: A prominent Geraldton cricketer is found guilty of running over his 18-year-old girlfriend, causing serious injuries and showing what a judge describes as a "breathtaking lack of regard" for the victim.

title.children: Two years jail for WA man who ran over former girlfriend in ute and sped away without helping

image.altText: Close up of a glass jar containing blue ring shaped lollies

props.synopsis: Police in Perth charge a 16-year-old boy with manufacturing a batch of cannabis-laced gummies and selling them to a 16-year-old girl, who then fell ill along with another female student after the pair ingested them.

title.children: Cannabis lollies allegedly made and sold by WA schoolboy leave two fellow students in hospital

image.altText: An Aboriginal woman stares straight at the camera in a black shirt with curly brown hair

props.synopsis: A two-year inquiry has recommended widespread reform of police practices when responding to First Nations missing and murdered cases.

title.children: Inquiry calls for urgent, widespread reform of how police treat Indigenous missing and murdered cases

image.altText: HIMARS rocket launch

props.synopsis: The US will remove critical export and arms regulations in order to encourage trade of weapons and military technology between the three AUKUS partners.

title.children: Weapons export rules removed for trade between Australia and AUKUS partners

image.altText: Men carry a blue body bag on a stretcher

props.synopsis: The Palestinian Ministry of Health says a total 40,005 people have been killed and 92,401 injured since October 7, when Hamas-led militants attacked southern Israel, killing some 1,200 people — most of them civilians — and took roughly 250 hostages to Gaza, according to Israeli tallies.

title.children: Death toll in Gaza surpasses 40,000, Palestinian health officials say

image.altText: A full moon is seen through clouds above Stonehenge

props.synopsis: The 6-tonne stone at the centre of Stonehenge, long believed to have come from Wales, may have been transported via sea from Scotland, according to new research from a team led by Curtin University.

title.children: 'Completely unexpected': WA researchers stunned to find Stonehenge's Altar Stone may have come from 700km away

image.altText: A woman wearing a green and gold tracksuit holds her hands like a kangaroo on a purple stage with judges behind her

props.synopsis: Australian Olympic breakdancer Rachael Gunn has asked for the "hate" towards her family and friends to stop in the aftermath of a media furore over her performance in Paris.

title.children: Breaker Raygun calls for end to 'pretty devastating' Olympics reaction

image.altText: A close up shot of police tape with cars parked on a street and trees blurred in the background

props.synopsis: Detectives are investigating a crash that killed a toddler in Western Australia's Pilbara region last night.

title.children: Three-year-old girl killed in remote WA car rollover just days after baby's road death in state's Mid-West

image.altText: silhouetted coal mining digger next to a dump truck at a coal mine

props.synopsis: The Auditor General says she is concerned about transparency issues after the state government initially denied her office access to information about its legal fees relating to a failing coal mine.

title.children: WA government slammed for refusing to disclose legal fees in Griffin Coal's insolvency

image.altText: Picture of a smart meter in the meter box

props.synopsis: Like millions of Australians, Doreen Fawcett is grappling with a nightmare of unwanted power bill complexity. Calls for simplification are growing.

title.children: Perplexing, punishing power prices force industry to concede 'smart' meter overhaul not so clever

image.altText: three people holding rubiks cubes and wearing blue long sleep tops

props.synopsis: Karratha father Peiching Nie and his two children can solve a Rubik's cube in less than 20 seconds. They are aiming to get even faster by December, when they will test their mettle against competitors from overseas.

title.children: Speedcubing dad and kids eye records as they square up for international competition

image.altText: Zali Steggall speaks in the House of Representatives surrounded by Labor women

props.synopsis: The OG teal independent has always had an ability to get under the skin of the blokes in the Coalition, but Thursday seemed different, with Steggall at times having to shout to get over the wall of words.

title.children: As Dutton joined the heckles, a moment of kindness stopped business as usual in Parliament

image.altText: A pretty white woman with curled brown hair looks trepidatiously out of a glass court cell

props.synopsis: Ksenia Karelina's former employer said she had been raising money for charity when charged with treason.

title.children: Dual US-Russian citizen sentenced to 12 years in Russian prison over $75 donation

image.altText: A black and white photo of Glen Malcolm Conning in the cockpit of a helicopter on the ground.

props.synopsis: Family and friends of the New Zealand pilot shot dead in West Papua last week gather in his home town for a private funeral. He was remembered as a man with the Maori value of "mana".

title.children: NZ pilot shot dead in West Papua remembered by family and friends as a man with 'mana'

image.altText: A close up of a woman looking out a window.

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton's call for a temporary ban on accepting Palestinian refugees from Gaza has fuelled government accusations he is dividing the community.

title.children: Independent MP who fled war says debate over Gaza refugee ban is 'triggering', as Peter Dutton doubles down

image.altText: A woman in hi-vis and ear muffs using a metal grinder and creating sparks on the metal.

props.synopsis: The Skill Engineer program in the Kimberley town uses e-scooter construction and maintenance to teach at-risk youth critical skills.

title.children: As some cities contemplate bans, Broome is using e-scooters to tackle youth crime

image.altText: Nathan Cleary. favouring his left shoulder, walks off the field

props.synopsis: Penrith's push for a fourth consecutive NRL premiership has been rocked after star halfback Nathan Cleary injured his left shoulder in the 24-22 loss to fellow heavyweights Melbourne.

title.children: Penrith sweating on Cleary fitness after star halfback leaves field in Panthers' 24-22 loss to Melbourne

image.altText: Melbourne CBD people retail shopping

props.synopsis: The unemployment rate climbs to 4.2 per cent in July, despite data from the Australian Bureau of Statistics showing more than 58,000 people found work last month.

title.children: Employers are seeing a surge of applicants for new roles as Australia's unemployment rate climbs to 4.2 per cent

image.altText: Two men shake hands.

props.synopsis: A Pacific archipelago in Australia's backyard has become a new front in a bitter feud between France and Azerbaijan.

title.children: How France's enemy attacked its 'Achilles heel' off the coast of Australia

image.altText: A wide shot of the Train's home, with two sheds and a dam in sight.

props.synopsis: A woman close with Nathaniel, who made the missing persons report after not seeing him in person for 12 months, gives evidence at the Wieambilla shooting inquest.

title.children: Wieambilla inquest hears haunting final message to woman who reported Nathaniel Train missing

image.altText: A close up image of a woman with brown hair with her two thumbs up.

props.synopsis: It follows the country's constitutional court this week dismissing the prime minister, who had only been in power for less than a year.

title.children: Daughter of former billionaire Thai PM could be country's next leader

image.altText: A young boy dances in front of the Camps Breakerz studio in the Nuseirat refugee camp in the Gaza Strip.

props.synopsis: In the middle of a war zone in Gaza, children are performing breakdancing flips and jumps between the rubble. Meet the breakdancing crew keeping hope alive.

title.children: 'Breaking can heal trauma': Children in Gaza breakdance to hold on to hope

image.altText: A cross stands on a hill above Santa Teresa as the sun rises.

props.synopsis: Despite a landmark legal win against the NT government last year over the state of their public housing, residents in the remote community of Santa Teresa may have to wait years before they're awarded compensation.

title.children: Residents of tiny remote community living in uninhabitable homes could wait years for compensation

image.altText: A Rex Airlines plane stands on a runway.

props.synopsis: The federal government will guarantee all regional flight bookings for customers of Rex during its administration process over the next month.

title.children: Federal government guarantees regional flights for Rex customers during administration

image.altText: Megaupload founder Kim Dotcom

props.synopsis: The self-described "internet freedom fighter" has been fighting extradition to the United States since 2012 following an FBI-ordered raid on his Auckland mansion.

title.children: Internet mogul Kim Dotcom to be extradited to the US, NZ justice minister says

image.altText: a young girl

props.synopsis: A Gold Coast community is asking what more could have been done after the death of a little girl, allegedly at the hands of her mother.

title.children: Schoolgirl's alleged murder 'like a bomb' in Gold Coast's tight-knit Chinese community

image.altText: Star trails over land and water

props.synopsis: Sink into your chair and prepare your brain for a battle with knowledge. With questions ranging from the Moon to Sirius and celestial gems outside our galaxy, this quiz will stretch the boundaries of your mind.

title.children: Think you're pretty night-sky-smart? Take our star-crossed quiz to find out

image.altText: A teacher is seen at the front of a primary school classroom

props.synopsis: Upwey South Primary School's academic results have lifted dramatically over the past six years. The principal puts it down to a shift in teaching styles.

title.children: This public school's academic results have skyrocketed over the past six years. Here's how they did it

image.altText: A split image with two smiling women, one an NRLW team coach, the other a Queensland Maroons coach.

props.synopsis: The NRL recognises the finest female players of the pre semi-professional era, elevating its first six women into the Hall of Fame in a historic moment for rugby league.

title.children: Karyn Murphy and Tahnee Norris among six women inducted into NRL Hall of Fame in historic rugby league moment

image.altText: A colour drawing of a baseballer standing in the batter's box, pointing his bat down the middle of the field.

props.synopsis: The record price for a piece of sports memorabilia is set to be smashed in the United States, with a World Series shirt worn by baseball great Babe Ruth already drawing huge bids for an auction later this month.

title.children: 'Like buying the Mona Lisa': Babe Ruth 'called shot' jersey could smash record at auction
